newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Arab wounded in West Bank shooting - official.
newsitem.headline: Arab wounded in West Bank shooting - official.

text.p: A Palestinian suspected of cooperating with Israeli security forces was shot twice in the head in the West Bank on Wednesday, a spokesman for Israel's Magen David Adom ambulance service said.

"He was very seriously wounded and taken to hospital in Israel," the spokesman said. "He is a local Arab man suspected of collaboration and he was shot twice in the head at a petrol station near the village of Kfar Azzoun."

Israel Army Radio said the Palestinian was hit by gunfire from a car with yellow Israeli licence plates which drove off towards the Israeli town of Kfar Saba. It reported the background to the shooting appeared to be "criminal".
A wave of violence has swept the West Bank since Israel broke ground for a Jewish settlement in Arab East Jerusalem on March 18.
